did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: George C. Marshall High School Evaluation Committee Collection1965-1966
did.abstract: Support materials for the committee doing the evaluation of George C. Marshall High School in 1965-66.
did.origination: George C. Marshall High School; Raymond J. Poindexter

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], The George C. Marshall High School Evaluation Committee Collection, 1965-1966, SC# 5048, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by Gordon W. Miller April 6, 2012 after he acquired it from Eastern Mennonite University.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Dr. Raymond J. Poindexter taught at Madison College beginning in 1949 and ending in 1969. He served as a Professor of Education as well as the Director of Student Teaching. As the Director of Student Teaching, Dr. Poindexter coordinated the placement of JMU students into local public schools for teaching experience. Dr. Poindexter served as Chairman for the George C. Marshall High School Evaluating Committee in 1965. George C. Marshall High School was founded in 1963 in Falls Church, Virginia in Fairfax County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The George C. Marshall High School Evaluation Committee Collection, 1965-1966, consists of two folders. The first folder contains the Evaluation Committee Packet, put together by Dr. Poindexter. The packet contains a letter from Dr. Poindexter addressing the committee, the schedule of the evaluation committee, assignments for each individual subject committee along with contact information for key committee members, and evaluative criteria and procedures. The school bell schedule, master schedule, and map are also included. The second folder contains the George C. Marshall High School Faulty Handbook, 1965-1966.
